etymologies: mid 19th century. Apparently from Mexican Spanish canaigre, cañagre, cañaigre (both 1902 or earlier), variants of cañagria from caña agria, lit. ‘sour reed’ from caña + agria, feminine of agrio sour

definitions: A species of dock, Rumex hymenosepalus (family Polygonaceae), native to the south-western United States and northern Mexico, having clusters of pink flowers, long taproots high in tannin, and edible thick reddish stems and large fleshy leaves.
